results.content: I was looking for something more on practical use of shortcuts, etc. But for what this course is described, it's done quite well. One star off for not including more on the difference with the Windows version of Sublime. But well done overall!

results.content_html: I was looking for something more on practical use of shortcuts, etc. But for what this course is described, it's done quite well. One star off for not including more on the difference with the Windows version of Sublime. But well done overall!

results.content:
Nice guy/presentation, but seriously lacking meaningful content that you couldn't find on youtube for free.

The content is geared toward "dolling up" the way sublime text looks (font color, size, themes) and introduces a few packages to users that definitely help/expedite coding, but again there are plenty of youtube and stack overflow post that will give you the same content info..

From the course title, I was under the impression the tutorial would walk sublime users thru properly configuring sublime packages/json files/etc to the user's "code" libraries (i.e. build) so it can be used as an IDE in multiple languages (I would argue this is its greatest selling point).  

Overall, I think its worth a buck or two, but does not come close to measuring up to any other "course" I have bought on Udemy.
results.content_html:
Nice guy/presentation, but seriously lacking meaningful content that you couldn't find on youtube for free.

The content is geared toward "dolling up" the way sublime text looks (font color, size, themes) and introduces a few packages to users that definitely help/expedite coding, but again there are plenty of youtube and stack overflow post that will give you the same content info..

From the course title, I was under the impression the tutorial would walk sublime users thru properly configuring sublime packages/json files/etc to the user's "code" libraries (i.e. build) so it can be used as an IDE in multiple languages (I would argue this is its greatest selling point).

Overall, I think its worth a buck or two, but does not come close to measuring up to any other "course" I have bought on Udemy.
